title: Projects and Case Studies
text:
This page highlights selected projects and assignments from my MBA program and work experiences. Each project includes the problem, my approach, and what I learned.


Role: Marketing Officer
Problem
The company needed improvement in social media engagement and consistent messaging.
What I Did
- Created and scheduled digital content
- Coordinated with the marketing team
- Suggested task sequencing and visual consistency improvements
What I Learned
I learned to plan and schedule digital content effectively and understood the importance of unified visual style for brand messaging.



Role: People Management / HR
Problem
The storeâ€™s presentation and product arrangement needed improvement.
What I Did
- Organized shelves
- Assisted customers
- Helped manage inventory and daily stock
What I Learned
I learned how store layout and presentation affect customer experience and gained experience in inventory and customer service tasks.



Course: Marketing Management
Type: Short written assignment
Context
I analyzed a consumer product using segmentation.
What I Did
- Described the product
- Identified target audience
- Suggested channels and positioning
What I Learned
Segmentation helps marketers focus their message on a clear audience.

title: Home
text:
About Me
I am an MBA candidate at University Canada West with interests in
operations, digital transformation, and data-driven decision making.
This portfolio highlights selected coursework, projects, and skills that
demonstrate my analytical thinking, collaboration, and communication.

title: Resume
text:
Professional Summary
My background is in media and marketing. My career started as marketing officer with enhacing hands-on experience on branding, plan campaign, and customer engagement. Currently through pursuing MBA, I am exploring to creative marketing insights with analytical and strategic decision making to support business growth and innovation.

title: Resume
text:

Master of Business Administration (MBA)
University Canada West, Vancouver, BC
Expected graduation: 2026

Operations Management, Digital Transformation, Marketing Management, People Analytics
